briefdescription.para: Initialize 1D plasma data and check inputs.

detaileddescription.para: Before calling this function, the offload struct is expected to be fully initialized.

The offload array is expected to hold plasma data as
[0] = rho grid
[n_rho] = electron temperature [J]
[n_rho*2] = ion temperature [J]
[n_rho*2 + n_rho*n_ions] = electron density [m^-3]
[n_rho*2 + n_rho*n_ions + n_rho] = ion density [m^-3]
Since this data requires no initialization, the only thing this function does is that it prints some values as sanity check.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to pointer to offload array

briefdescription.para: Free offload array and reset parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to pointer to offload array

briefdescription.para: Initialize magnetic field data struct on target.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies the magnetic field parameters from the offload struct to the struct on target and sets the plasma data pointers to correct offsets in the offload array.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to data struct on target

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the temperature of a plasma species at the given radial coordinate using linear interpolation.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to where evaluated temperature [J] is stored

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the density of a plasma species at the given radial coordinate using linear interpolation.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to where evaluated density [m^-3] is stored

briefdescription.para: Evaluate plasma density and temperature for all species.

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the density and temperature of all plasma species at the given radial coordinate using linear interpolation.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to where interpolated densities [m^-3] are stored
pointer to where interpolated temperatures [J] are stored

detaileddescription.para: Plasma data which is defined in a 1D uniform grid from which the values are interpolated linearly. The coordinate is the normalized poloidal flux.
